lg.l: Whoever of men is so wise and so clever,
That they may tell, who drives me on my journey
When I arise strong, and fierce at times,
Travel throughout the earth, I burn halls,
grey over roofs. Din is over the eart,
the slaughter of men, when I stir the woods,
the bold groves, and fell trees,
driven on my way, wide sent;
I have on my back that which before had covered
together on the sea. Say who covers me,
or what I am called, who these burdens bears.
